caseSubject: Contempt of Court/Non-compliance of Court Order
caseTitle: Sultan Ahmed v. Registrar, Balochistan High Court, Quetta and others
authorJudge: (1) Mr. Justice Syed Mansoor Ali Shah (2) Mr. Justice Shahid Waheed
tagline:
(i) The duty of the High Courts to protect the judges of the district judiciary is inherent in and concomitant with the power to supervise and control vested in them under Article 203 of the Constitution; (ii) It is imperative for the High Courts to protect the district judiciary from any executive onslaught or intrusion that may weaken its institutional independence or tends to lower its judicial fiat and brings it into disrespect.

Tagline (2): The additional note addresses the delicate balance between two constitutional values: the independence of the judiciary and the imperative of preventing crime, all within the framework of upholding the rule of law and prescribes safeguards for the protection and independence of the judges of the district judiciary in relation to criminal cases.
